p:
Also note that if m
γ = 0 in equation ( 2.3), we recover the single strain case P 1 = min{0,1/ R 1}, as expected. This is also true if R 1 − 1 − m
γ ≫ 4 m
γ (1 − P 2) R 1, implying that if there is little or no fitness cost, with R 1 > 1 and m
γ ≪ 1, the probability of emergence behaves as if we had a single strain branching process. Therefore, the step-down and step-up do not have an unnecessary effect if R 1 is not reduced by a fitness cost.
